snippet: A Brooklyn bar is fighting a $2,500 fine it received for a help-wanted advertisement that said being British was an advantage in getting a job there.
abstract: New York City Commission on Human Rights has accused Longbow Pub and Pantry, British pub in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, of discrimination for posting help-wanted advertisement that said being British would be hiring advantage; bar is fighting $2,500 fine levied by commission.
lead_paragraph: A Brooklyn bar is fighting a $2,500 fine it received for a help-wanted advertisement that said being British was an advantage in getting a job there.
